subject: Creativity
title: Voice: How Characters Sound Different from Each Other
description: A quick win: understand Voice: How Characters Sound Different from Each Other.

hook.text: Cover the dialogue tags. Can you tell who's speaking from the words alone? If yes, the characters have voice.

buildup.text: Voice includes vocabulary, sentence length, rhythm, what a character notices, and what they avoid saying.

discovery.text: A professor and a teenager describe the same sunset differently. The professor analyzes; the teenager photographs it.

twist.text: Many writers give all characters the same voice â€” their own. The fix: ask 'what would THIS person never say?

climax.text: Toni Morrison could make you hear a character's background, education, region, and emotional state in a single sentence.

punchline.text: When every character sounds different, the writer disappears. That's mastery.

quiz.question: What's the test for whether characters have distinct voices?
options: You can identify the speaker with dialogue tags removed
